pros: The people, the benefits, the environment and the cooperation.
cons: As with most companies, we struggle with being under-staffed.

review_title: They don’t care about their employees
job_title: Registered Nurse in West Havre, MT
pros: Nothing positive with the hospital, only pro I can think of is helping and caring for patients. A few good doctors.
cons: It the hospital has its clicks, ED staff are stuck up and rude. Managers and administration pick on the RNs working the floor. Higher ups do not treat you like a human, you are just a number to them and a way to make them money. Instead of communicating to everyone if someone doesn’t like you they single you out. I wouldn’t trust some of the care given here, nor do they take the time to listen and sit with you.

job_title: Professional Medical Coder in Havre, MT
cons: They pay way below the median average. They will tell you that you will get a pay increase but it will not happen. They take advantage of you.

pros:
The bonus were nice
The benefits were good
cons:
The management didn't seem to understand work restrictions and you would get harassed for them.
They also didn't understand personal time and you would be called constantly on you time off.

pros: The benefits provide when the benefits provide when needed at time required can be used.
cons: The salary given when compared with the salary given at the time of employment for the expenses that where needed appeared to be low

review_title: Great hospital that could be better.
pros: Only hospital in the region and the largest employer in the county.  Our patient care is excellent.  This is a small and tight-knit community where everyone knows each other.  This means that almost all of our patients are known personally by the staff.  So we are really caring for our neighbors, not just anonymous patients.  Our medical staff is superb.  These physicians are not here to show off what car they drive or how big their house is.  They are here for our rural western lifestyle and because we treat each other very well.  Unlike many hospitals that say their staff is a team, we actually are.
cons: Our wages are low and benefits are mediocre.  This is because we are somewhat isolated and have no direct local competition.  If one wanted to seek hogher wages, the next hospital is 110 miles away.

pros: Positive environment and enjoyed everyone I worked with
cons: If it was slow there really wasn’t anything else to do. Wasn’t given any kind of side work.

pros: Patients; longevity; cancer facility; there are some very golden people who work there but are covered by workplace violence.
cons: Severe workplace violence. Blame culture. Longevity. Some RNs do not even have a clue about patient care and customer service. Lost their passion and what they are even working for.
